content.1: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;
content.2: As it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
content.3: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
content.4: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
content.5: And there went out unto him all the land of Judæa, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
content.6: And John was clothed with camel’s hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;
content.7: And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
content.8: I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.
content.9: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
content.10: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:
content.11: And there came a voice from heaven,
content.12: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
content.13: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
content.14: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
content.16: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
content.18: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.

content.21: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.
content.22: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.

content.28: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
content.29: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
content.30: But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.
content.31: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
content.32: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
content.33: And all the city was gathered together at the door.
content.34: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.
content.35: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
content.36: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.
